intro: Neottianthe cucullata f. maculata, commonly known as the spotted orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that often feature distinctive spots or markings. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are borne on tall, slender stems. The botanical features of this plant make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
